content.title: Divyang Pension Scheme
content.details: Divyang Pension scheme is a social security scheme by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to the specially abled people of the state, who do not have any means of livelihood of their own or can not do any kind of hard work to sustain them.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.
The applicant should be more than eighteen (18) years of age.
The applicant should belong to Person with Disabilities (PWD) category having more than 40% disability.
Applicant’s monthly income should not exceed ₹4,000/-.
Should belong to the BPL (Below Poverty Level) category.
exclusions: The applicant should not be a beneficiary of any other Pension.
documents_required: BPL certificate or income certificate issued by the Tahsildar (Monthly income not exceeding ₹4,000/-).
Proposal for open meeting of Gram Sabha.
Disability Certificate (exceeding 40%) issued by the Chief Medical Officer or Unique Disability ID (UDID) Card.

faqs.question: What is the objective of “Divyang Pension” scheme?
faqs.answer: “Divyang Pension” scheme is a social security scheme by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand, that provides financial assistance to the visually impaired, speech impaired and physically challenged destitute persons of the state.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this Scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme has been launched by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand.

faqs.question: Who are the targeted beneficiaries under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Person with Disabilities (PWD) are the targeted beneficiaries under this scheme.

faqs.question: What kind of financial assistance can be availed through this scheme?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance of ₹1500/- per month is provided to the beneficiaries.

faqs.question: What should be the age criteria for the applicant?
faqs.answer: The applicant should be more than eighteen (18) years of age.

faqs.question: What should be the income criteria for the beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: The income of the beneficiary should not exceed ₹4000/- per month.

faqs.question: How can the application be submitted?
faqs.answer: Applications can be made online at https://ssp.uk.gov.in/Home.aspx.

faqs.question: Whether the application can be tracked?
faqs.answer: Yes, applications can be tracked from https://ssp.uk.gov.in/frmApplicantionVerificationDetailAtDiffLevels.aspx by providing Application Number/Mobile number/Aadhaar number.

faqs.question: What is the frequency of the pension?
faqs.answer: The pension will be provided on a monthly basis to the beneficiaries.
